meanings.definition: To remove the nucleus from a cell.
meanings.sent1: The scientist will enucleate the cell for further study.
meanings.sent2: The surgeon needed to enucleate the damaged cell.
meanings.sent3: It was like playing a game of 'operation' trying to enucleate the tiny cell.
meanings.sent4: She carefully enucleated the nucleus from the cell, like a delicate surgery.
meanings.sent5: The process of enucleating the cell requires precision and skill.

meanings.definition: To remove the core or central part of something.
meanings.sent1: The chef will enucleate the apple before slicing it.
meanings.sent2: It is important to enucleate the truth from the rumors.
meanings.sent3: He tried to enucleate the core of the issue during the meeting.
meanings.sent4: Her words enucleated the heart of the matter, leaving no room for doubt.
meanings.sent5: Enucleating the core allows us to see the essence of the problem clearly.

meanings.definition: To extract or remove something completely.
meanings.sent1: The dentist had to enucleate the decayed tooth.
meanings.sent2: It is necessary to enucleate all the weeds from the garden.
meanings.sent3: She decided to enucleate all distractions to focus on her work.
meanings.sent4: The detective enucleated all evidence to solve the case.
meanings.sent5: Enucleating the unnecessary elements helped streamline the process.
